children.subject: Have an internship, so summer classes are a no-go. Would've been nice as it's cheaper overall.

Not necessarily? A full-time internship typically leaves you with free evenings and weekends. You’ll be sacrificing a bit of enjoyment over the summer, but it’ll make your life easier this semester. If you really want, you can self-study 53 a bit this semester (during your “free time”) to make the summer course even easier. Just my two cents.

I'll look into it and see if it's doable online, thanks for the suggestion! Not too sure what my workload is going to be like at my internship but I'm pretty new to actual work so I expect that I'll already be self-studying a lot in whatever time I have during the summer, so not too sure if I'll be fine juggling both.

I don't know how graduation works with summer classes, but Math 53 is usually offered over the summer (and often online, too). If the graduation logistics work out, perhaps try postponing 53 to the summer?

EECS graduation requirement. I'm graduating early and this just happened to be one of the classes I have remaining that I could get into. If I drop 53, I'll be staying an extra semester for just one more required class.

I see. That's tough. Try to talk to a counselor about that. You are probably going to be miserable given all of your academic and non-academic commitments. I'm not trying to discourage you, it's just a really tough schedule.
I was also in Math53 last semester before I dropped because it was such a time commitment with two weekly homework, weekly quizzes, etc. And the material is not trivial...

OP again. I've been talking to various class TAs all day including the Director of the Math 53 adjunct I want to attend; for someone like me without a very heavy math background I'll want to take the adjunct as well, which is like a 1.5-2x increase in "required" workload of homeworks and quizzes (adjunct is a p/np class but its content is basically what every student should do for good preparation). Most TAs said I'll have it rough and to see how I feel right before drop deadline, but one thought 53 was straightforward. I can see my workload ballooning later on and I'm erring on the side of dropping, though I'll wait until Feb 13th to decide.

Could you do it? Probably. But I do not recommend it. Every single one of these classes is considered moderate to heavy workload. Plus you are teaching a DeCal and involved in other extracurriculars. Why do you want/need to take Math53?

history.content:
I know class schedule difficulty depends on the student, and we see a lot of these posts here and on various Berkeley forums, but I'm struggling to decide whether I should drop a class as that would require me to stay (and pay) for another semester.

Currently taking: CS 161, CS 184, EE16B, Math 53.

Also doing CS 195, teaching a DeCal, and various club activities.

Math 53 is what I'm contemplating dropping, since we have weekly homeworks (graded on pass/fail) and weekly quizzes. My math background is alright but I haven't taken a formal math class in a while so I expect that I'll be doing a fair bit of textbook review, adding to the time spent. 161 and 184 will have projects and homeworks that take a while, but my other concern is EE16B which is with Sahai this semester. I've heard he creates more workload in classes but I've also heard that his EE16B is pretty aligned with "normal" EE16B work, so I'm not sure what to believe here. Any input is appreciated, thanks!
history.subject: Schedule Workload
